data.headline: Nasdaq led declines as renewed AI-driven disruption fears sparked a rout in tech and AI-related stocks
bullets: Big Tech names including Apple, Nvidia, Meta, Amazon, and Netflix were sharply lower, with Apple pressured by Siri delays
Cisco plunged around 11% after issuing weak guidance, weighing on software and networking peers
Semiconductor stocks and perceived AI 'losers' like Palantir, Shopify, and Micron also sold off heavily
AI 'fear trade' spread to logistics (C.H. Robinson, RXO) and real estate services (CBRE, JLL), broadening sector weakness
Dow, S&P 500, and Russell 2000 each fell over 1% as traders rotated into value and cyclical stocks
Mixed jobs data added to uncertainty as markets braced for Friday's CPI report
After-hours focus shifted to earnings from Coinbase, Applied Materials, and Rivian
McDonald's stood out as a rare bright spot amid widespread selling
